intro: Hieracium leucograptum, commonly known as the white-stemmed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are yellow with white markings. It is a perennial plant that spreads through rhizomes and is sometimes considered invasive in certain regions.
